editionStmt.edition: A new edition, with semantic markup, punctuation, accentuation, emendation, and notes.

respStmt.name: Alexander Loney, ed.
J.-P. Fournet Hellénisme dans l’Égypt du vie siècle: La Bibliothèque et l’oeuvre de Dioscore d’Aphrodité. pp. 9-86
G. Ioannidou BKT 9.133

publicationStmt.publisher: The Center for Hellenic Studies of Harvard University

authority.name: Casey Dué and Mary Ebbott, edd.

change.item: Collation of editions and initial XML markup.

div.head: Date
div.p: Late fifth or early fourth century A.D. (Fournet, 17)

div.head: Provenance
div.p: Kum Isqaw, from the Library of Dioscorus of Aphrodito. (Fournet, 10)

item.bibl: van Thiel, H. 1996. Homeri Ilias Hildesheim: Olms.
West, M.L. 2001. Studies in the Text and Transmission of the Iliad Leipzig: Saur.
Fournet, J.-P. 1999. Hellénisme dans l’Égypt du vie siècle: La Bibliothèque et l’oeuvre de Dioscore d’AphroditéMIFAO 115: 9-86.

list.item: Mertens-Pack 658(The third edition of Mertens-Pack collated together the fragments formerly numbered 658, 864, 885, and 888)

Allen-Sutton-West P 46Formerly, these fragments were numbered p46, p146, p355, p495, and p695. ML West (West, 88-129) still numbers these seperately. Ioannidou's suggestion that P.Berol. 21229 (Allen-Sutton-West p695) belongs to this same papyrus (Ioannidou, 173), adopted by Sutton in the previous edition of the H and P database, cannot be correct, since the beginnings of lines 10.372-74 overlap in the two fragments and duplicate the same letters. I have thus excluded p695 from this edition.
P.Cairo Maspero inv. 67172-4; P.Berol. inv. 10570; P. Strasb. inv. G 1654; P.Rein. 2.70
